page.title: 16RELIGION-GREAT PAXTON
page.content: WORSHIP- SAXON CHURCHES.In 1985 religion does not seem to be as important as it used to be.There are 67 members of Gt.Paxton church but only about 20 people regularly worship there.It's vicar,the Reverend E.Pryke has recently retired and moved to Devon,so at present there is no permanent vicar.Nevertheless the Saxon church is very interesting and notable.It is one of the largest late Saxon churches in England and seems to have been copied from continental churches in the 10th century.The original church was built around 1020A.D.and the chancel was added in the 13th century.In the 14th c.,the porch was built and the tower too.The aisles were rebuilt in the 15th c.Some windows were addad in the chancel and the buttresses built.A major restoration took place in 1880.
